mods.abstract: Born in Georgia in 1794. He fought in the Battle of New Orleans. James White was the father of Dr. Thos. White, dec'd of Pulaski. When a small boy, his father immigrated to Middle Tennessee and settled in Sumner County near Gallatin. After remaining there a few years, he moved with his family down the Cumberland River near the site now Fort Donelson. Making but a short stay at this place, he removed and located in Maury County. He taught school in Maury County until the spring of 1820. He then came to Giles County and married Matilda Gooch. Esq. White was an elder in the Pleasant Hill congregation, C. P. Church, for about forty years.

titleInfo.title: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
